questions.question_text: A newly established CSP allows for drive shipping to upload new data into the environment. Sensitive data on 40TB of storage needs to be transferred within one week. Which of the following is the MOST efficient and secure method for shipment of the data to the CSP with minimal downtime?

discussion.content: You want to copy the data, you will need the data until it is uploaded onto the new environment. Answer is B

Answer is B least amount of downtime*. Copy = no downtime while in transit.
Move = Turn off the drives and move them to new location which = downtime.

comments.content: That makes perfect sense. Never even thought of that.

discussion.content: B makes sense then why is D selected?
The key word in the question is transfer.

based on that, retaining a copy is always best practice since you are introducing risk by shipping it. If the data were to be lost/stolen/destroyed, you would still be protected by having data on encrypted drives and a copy of it for migration to the new cloud.

D. is the correct answer. Although not the wisest way to do business, the question asks for most EFFICIENT solution which would not be B since you'd be copying/retaining an excessive 40TB of online data.

comments.content: You are wrong this is a classic compTIA word play question if you MOVE the data you no longer have the data at your facility which is a horrible idea itself. You want to COPY that data to drives to be sent while you still have a COPY on site to use!

choices.B: Copy the data to encrypted drives and use the CSP-certified shipping provider.
choices.D: Move the data to encrypted drives and use the CSP-certified shipping provider.
choices.A: Create a VPN between the sites and schedule data transfer during non-business hours.
choices.C: Compress and SFTP the data to the CSP.

choices.A: Weekly full backups with daily incremental backups
choices.C: Weekly full backups with daily differential backups
choices.B: Weekly clones with daily incremental backups
choices.D: Weekly and daily snapshots via the hypervisor

questions.question_text:
A backup solution for a new cloud environment must meet the following requirements:
* Use no more than two backup sets for a complete restore.
* Minimize backup space used.
* Support physical and virtual machines.
Which of the following BEST meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
C is the correct answer. 

"A differential backup contains all of the changed data since the last full backup. This allows for faster restore times since the process takes only two steps, restoring the full backup and then restoring the most recent differential backup."

questions.question_text: A manufacturing company's current security policy mandates PII is not stored in the SaaS solution. Which of the following configuration controls should be used to block sensitive information from being stored in the SaaS solution?

comments.content: They also mentioned "SaaS", how are you supposed to implement a network ACL on the SaaS provider's equipment? Answer is D

discussion.content:
D is correct because PII is based on the content of the text,
a network ACL will stop network traffic not specifically traffic carrying PII

Selected Answer: D
D. Content filtering can help detect PII in the contents and block it
B could be correct. If you store in your own server PII, with an network ACL you can block communications between your server and the SaaS solution.
The Answer is D. It is scary that the site puts ACL as the answer.
it is D, PII is content, an ACL would filter only traffic and not their content.
D you want DLP solution and app data is closest
Please explain why D is the answer?

Selected Answer: B
Synchronous replication would have the most updated data

questions.question_text:
A cloud engineer is building a disaster recovery plan for a private cloud. Business requirements state that recovery must be to a separate DR location and that
RPO and RTO must be minimized. Which of the following disaster recovery solutions BEST meets these requirements?

choices.B: Synchronous replication to another site 50mi (80.5km) away
choices.D: Asynchronous replication to another site 50mi (80.5km) away
choices.A: Synchronous replication to another site 700mi (1126km) away
choices.C: Asynchronous replication to another site 700mi (1126km) away

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
to centralize accounts from other Saas, nothing to do with automation

questions.question_text: A company wants to integrate public cloud offerings to address its growing business units. The company uses many different applications from partners, and account access management hinders user experience. The company wants an efficient centralized solution. Which of the following would BEST address the issue?
